name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"e2522eec-faf6-47ac-acac-1e9ae4980605","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d5dacb69-bb2e-48b2-a693-816111e9acef","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class is the central coordination point for tracking data flow as it exits functions. In static analysis, simply knowing a function returns a value is not enough; you must track which variable in the calling scope "catches" that value. This class manages that mapping by organizing ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects by namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ae5b0e07-2a7a-4da8-b06c-6a018cf90e05","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"8599e543-75e9-48d5-88e8-288f468a6c2f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e03f7c46-6cdc-477a-999f-1e3378f2e69d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"returns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The internal registry. Keys are strings representing the namespace (e.g., a function or class path), and values are lists of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instances.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1bdb7467-4a63-414e-9aff-96a752b79f1f","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"a37fa454-b0e3-48fa-b977-ec09fe76fa6c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"88687199-069f-4ddb-bb4e-40be82928534","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__()
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes a fresh ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with an empty registry.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"623a072b-4333-4122-bb49-bfdb4ce539d6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_return()
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Returns the entire ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"returns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dictionary. This provides a "God-eye view" of all tracked returns across the entire project.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"85cb54ea-f58f-4e1d-b087-f77b7e3c0bfb","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_returnitem(currentNs, left, row, right)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Creates and stores a new return record.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"ffeeb5f9-2d35-42a3-b0b9-434a1f54dbca","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"currentNs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The namespace where the return is being captured.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ffd7989b-30c3-4ed2-8bfe-9ff5284c38e1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"left","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The variable or target receiving the value.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cc038669-ec81-4a4f-ab2f-84c526746338","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The line number of the operation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b213cdf7-6a19-4c01-b0be-a83b59dc3f9d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"right","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The source function path (this is automatically processed to extract the base namespace).","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"362a7fc4-4a56-4792-84fa-ad2e13d86cb4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_returnitem(currentNs)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Returns the list of all ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ReturnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects associated with a specific namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2f24a769-48fd-4386-b0d3-a13670c5277e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"pop_returnItem(currentNs, row, funcName)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Searches for a specific return record. If found, it ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"removes","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the record from the registry and returns the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"left","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (target) value. This is used when the analysis has successfully linked the caller and callee.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bc7274dd-90c4-4cde-8abf-8b5d83cc50b7","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"peek_returnItem(currentNs, row, funcName)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Similar to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pop_returnItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", but ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"does not remove","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the record. Useful for look-ahead analysis where you need to verify a relationship without consuming it.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2ba4612f-5f2b-4803-aa57-d283d3fa7a2e","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"400bb894-f3bd-462e-966b-20d06a8d99a5","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8670ce5e-9109-406c-8ab8-bc20484c60ac","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"In this scenario, we are analyzing a script where ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data = fetch_user()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is called inside a function named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"process_logic","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"42808737-aa2f-4ef2-98a1-46910f49ddb1","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from returns import ReturnManager

# 1. Setup the manager
manager = ReturnManager()

# 2. Add a return item
# Context: In 'process_logic', at line 45, 'data' receives a value from 'auth.fetch_user'
manager.add_returnitem(
    currentNs="app.services.process_logic",
    left="data",
    row=45,
    right="auth.fetch_user"
)

# 3. Peek to see what 'data' is linked to without removing it
target = manager.peek_returnItem("app.services.process_logic", 45, "auth")
print(f"Target found: {target}") # Output: Target found: data

# 4. Inspect all returns for this specific namespace
items = manager.get_returnitem("app.services.process_logic")
print(f"Pending returns in this scope: {len(items)}")

# 5. Finalize and "Pop" the return once the analysis of that line is complete
resolved_var = manager.pop_returnItem("app.services.process_logic", 45, "auth")
print(f"Resolved and removed: {resolved_var}")

# 6. Verify it is gone
remaining = manager.get_returnitem("app.services.process_logic")
print(f"Remaining items: {len(remaining)}") # Output: Remaining items: 0","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"77b81cb9-4bfc-417e-ac69-364614836e65","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c488c95f-0f56-4f9f-9dc1-44b7f9f34872","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace Normalization","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": When using ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_returnitem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"right","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" parameter is automatically processed using ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils.join_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". If you pass ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth.fetch_user","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it stores the source as ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", focusing on the module/provider level.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3faf52d2-7b08-4ad4-95e2-e56897cc347e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Context Awareness","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By requiring both the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"funcName","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the manager prevents collisions in cases where a single function makes multiple calls to the same module on different lines.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"48175cfd-9bbd-4c64-b8e4-59d891d07c23","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
